weekly_top5.name: Phillips 66

target.bear_case_note: Deal/asset-purchase narrative fades or is re-priced; energy/refining macro reversal (crack spreads) pulls the group lower; loss of breakout momentum (fails to hold short-term moving averages).

primary_catalyst.title: M&A / asset purchase newsflow (UK Lindsey refinery assets)
primary_catalyst.why_it_matters: Confirmed acquisition announcement can drive follow-through buying and analyst revisions; integration/strategic footprint expansion can re-rate refining/cash-flow expectations over the next week as details circulate.

sources.title: Phillips 66 to buy Prax Lindsey refinery assets in UK
PSX Expands UK Footprint With Lindsey Refinery Asset Purchase

risk_factors: Event may be partially priced after initial pop; follow-through depends on incremental details/analyst revisions.
Energy/refining is highly macro-sensitive (crack spreads, crude moves); a sector pullback can overwhelm single-name momentum.

weekly_top5.name: AbbVie Inc.

primary_catalyst.why_it_matters: Takeover speculation can create near-term volatility and re-pricing of strategic pipeline optionality; follow-up headlines (confirmation/denial/terms) can drive a sharp move within days.

sources.title: AbbVie denies media reports of talks to buy Revolution Medicines

risk_factors: Catalyst is not a confirmed scheduled event; ABBV explicitly denied talks, reducing probability of a bullish follow-through.
Large-cap pharma typically has lower short-horizon realized moves; ≥10% in 7 trading days is less common without a binary event.
